description: If you're in big trouble, call the World Welfare Work Association or WWWA for short. They will send out a team of highly trained and capable agents called Trouble Consultants who can solve your problems. But if the team they send you is the Dirty Pair, solving your problems could come at the cost of a lot of collateral damage.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
Kouichi Mashimo is a well-known Japanese anime director and the founder of the animation studio Bee Train. Since the creation of the studio, Mashimo directed or otherwise participated in (nearly) all its works, for example, as a member of art or sound department.

Mashimo was born in Tokyo, Japan and from his early years showed interest in photography, admittedly under the influence of his father. Mashimo studied jurisprudence at Sophia University and during his fourth university year, he participated in the making of several television commercials. However, this was a rather disappointing experience, and on November 6, 1975, he applied for a position of Hiroshi Sasagawa's assistant director in Tatsunoko Production. The first anime series he worked on was Time Bokan (1975–76).

In the mid-1980s, while still working for Tatsunoko, Mashimo survived a severe alpine skiing accident. During his stay in an intensive care unit, he came up with an idea of a "hospital for animators", an animation studio whose primary goal would be fostering and self-actualization of talented artists rather than commercial success and money. Some time after that, he founded a small freelance studio called Mashimo Jimusho that was mainly producing in-between animation for larger companies. In 1997, Mashimo presented his studio-as-hospital concept to Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, the president of Production I.G, who was so impressed with it that he immediately agreed to sponsor Mashimo. The new subsidiary has become known as Bee Train and in February 2006, it ended its relationship with I.G and became independent.

(Source: Wikipedia)

In 1979, Hosono made his debut with Crusher Joe while he was a student at Keio University. Around the same time, he joined the Studio Nue (スタジオぬえ) as an animator. He has had stories published in the manga anthology series Petit Apple Pie. He is the author of Gallery Fake and Tarō as well, for which two he won Shogakukan Manga Award for general manga in 1996.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kadutaka_nue)

Kazutaka Miyatake is a visual artist and anime designer known for the mechanical design of the Macross TV series and a number of its continuations from Studio Nue, of which he is a founding member. He has also contributed to the mecha design of other series such as Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny.

Kazutaka Miyatake has designed the spaceships of several famous anime series. His attention to detail and mechanical realism have made his designs still admired upon and used in anime series and related products after several years of their initial appearance.

__Real Name:__ Kimiyoshi Takekawa (竹川公訓)  

Haruka Takachiho is a Japanese science fiction author and founder of [Studio Nue](https://anilist.co/studio/199/Studio-Nue). Takachiho is best known as the creator of Crusher Joe, Dirty Pair and Dirty Pair Flash.

__Graduated:__ Tokyo Zokei University

Takizawa Toshifumi was a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

After he graduated Tokyo Zokei University, he got to work at Tokyo Animation Film, where he worked as part of a photography team. In later years he started working for Shin-Ei Douga, where he was a production assistant. After he started working at Nippon Sunrise, he became a director, giving his debut in 1985 with the Dirty Pair TV series. He continued working as a director afterwards, but as a freelancer instead.

He was a line director on the Ideon Be Invoked film, he was also involved in the Votoms series and has directed Gonzo's TV adaption of Kurosawa's epic Samurai 7 film, which he did in 2004.

Toshifumi passed away on June 22, 2015 from esophageal cancer. He was 61 years old when he died, and up until that point he would still be doing his ordinary activities like driving his car and walking his dog.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/土器手司)

A veteran animator best known for his involvement in the [Dirty Pair](https://anilist.co/anime/424/) franchise during the '80s, as well as the adaptations of [Rumiko Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96891/)'s works. His skills were first recognized by [Yasuhiko Yoshikazu](https://anilist.co/staff/97220/) during the production of [Giant Gorg](https://anilist.co/anime/3327/), who then put him in charge of supervising three of the episodes. He has been involved with numerous of [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s production's ever since.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1025616676341968896)

Shinji Kimura is a renown art director. He has also ventured into directing.

__Birthplace:__ Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E5%B7%9D%E4%BF%8A%E9%81%93)

Toshimichi Ookawa is a screenwriter and film director.

He graduated from the Faculty of Law, Meiji University in 1980. Made his screenwriting debut on Taiyou ni Hoero, a long-running prime-time detective series. In anime he debuted as a screenwriter on [Cat's Eye](https://anilist.co/anime/2043/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%98%9F%E5%B1%B1%E5%8D%9A%E4%B9%8B)

Hiroyuki Hoshiyama was a renown screenwriter. He started his career in [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) in 1967, but left it later in 1973 and worked as a freelancer until his passing.

[Blog](http://aminon.asablo.jp/blog/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%83%8E%E3%83%86%E3%83%84%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetsur%C5%8D_Amino)

Tetsurou Amino is a Japanese director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

In 1988, he started using his name in katakana.
